data.title: Merge pull request #1 from AtomicGameEngine/master
data.body: up

data.title: [Windows] AtomicEditor launches as Admin from installer
data.body: The first time the AtomicEditor is run from the installer, if "Launch Atomic Editor" is checked, it launches with elevated privileges

data.title: Fix for Filewatcher hanging on non-writeable folder, CEF logging
When closing project, clear hierarchy pane
Pass at cleaning up JS package registration
Add AtomicNETScript and AtomicApp to CI editor build
Added Max Size setting to Texture Importer
data.body:
This setting imposes the specified maximum dimensions on the compressed version of the texture in the cache.
Also fixes a case where the uncompressed file would have been loaded instead of the compressed version.

data.title: Refactor JS api initialization as main.js entry may depend on delayed registrations
data.body:
For example, the webview is initialized after main.js is called in this case:

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/AtomicEditor/Application/AEPlayerApp.cpp#L60

There should be a callback registration system which is fed initialization functions ahead of time, to ensure all API registrations happen before main.js is called

data.title: Core C# and Workflow Progress (+20 squashed commits)
data.body:
Squashed commits:
[a8adeb4] Working on C#
[e718ac3] Working on C#
[a76e6a0] C# Work
[50d89d7] For AtomicProject assembly copy on compile to resources
[d5a02dd] Add support for Main entry point with command line args for project assembly, fix crash for CS SharedPtr return values
[287712d] C# Work
[0aadeae] Expire event receivers
[b02e6a3] Adding generic version of ResourceCache query
[e6315f3] C# Work
[e5043a3] Fix bool marshaling
[c16e251] Allow multiple CSComponents on node, only call update if CS component is enabled
[13acad0] Adding C# component template
[19b54ed] Adding CSharpLanguageExtension also initial hook for playing managed player from editor
[ce26115] Compile AtomicProject.dll to Bin folder and copy resulting assembly to resources
[69a8573] Only run nuget restore before msbuild if necessary
[bfcf75f] Updating CS inpector fields on the fly
[087d4b5] NETBuildSystem able to build project assembly, from within the Atomic Editor
[9e1ec85] NETBuildSystem can now handle solution JSON configuration files
[f241a7e] CSharp Importer
[cc62b79] Adding NETBuildSystem, C# resource editor and importer, 2hz ToolSystem update event, cleanups

data.title: Updating Atomic WebView to Chrome 52
[LINUX] Atomic WebView GPU is disabled
data.body: Due to issues with GPU acceleration on Linux, possibly related to offscreen rendering, GPU is currently disabled with --disable-gpu switch in WebAppBrowser.cpp

data.title: Fixed issue #588: stop button now changes back to play after stopping project (Linux)
data.body: Replaced "kill" by "waitpid" call (see http://linux.die.net/man/2/waitpid).

data.title: Selective deployment configuration
data.body: This PR just fixes a compile error on clang and cleans up a configuration method, more info in the Original PR: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/921

data.title: Introduces selective build configuration
Color Picker and skin enhancements
data.body: Combined updates for PR, notes here: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/919

data.title: UI enhancements and color picker
data.body:
UI enhancements for #379 and #914

Added AccentColors elements to the light/dark skins, and used them to replace hex code colors in editor tb.txt files.
Replaced stock TB checkboxes in both skins with a blue square check box, fixed some instances when the UI files were referencing the grayed checkbox instead of the normal checkbox.
Replaced window and tab closer X in both skins with something better looking.
Added tooltips to the top editor icons for Translate, Rotate, Scale, and the Local/World button.
Created TBColorWidget and TBColorWheel widgets for use in the color picker
Added UISlider, UIColorWidget and UIColorWheel Atomic widgets, to make them scriptable.
Added a simple color picker to the color inspector.

data.title: Add a parameter to genvs2015 task to enable/disable ATOMIC_DEV_BUILD
data.body: This allows building the VS2015 solution without it having ATOMIC_DEV_BUILD set to 1. In our case this is useful for generating the solution for custom non-dev builds for artists. Will still default to 1.

data.title: Atomic C# Work In Progress
data.body: This PR adds build, runtime, and tooling support for AtomicNET.  It also cleans up Application code with the addition of AtomicApp module.   C# support is a work in progress and not ready for previewing, however it is at a good point to land on master to avoid a large running code delta.

data.title: ScriptVariantMap - add lookups by hash value
data.body: For performance reasons, add get by hash values to ScriptVariantMap to avoid string conversion.

data.title: [AtomicNET] - Support reusing project/solution UUID during project generation
data.body: Add a UUID to project configuration JSON settings to compliment auto creation, this will help when there are user settings dependent on UUID

data.title: User Interface problems
data.body:
These are (subjectively) annoying all platform user interface problems. 

*Add tooltips to the top editor icons for translate, rotate, scale, and the mysterious LOCAL button.
*The edit menu has a scrollbar, get rid of it.
*Convert dark skin checkboxes images to light_skin style checkboxes.
*The window_close and window_close_pressed images need to be changed to something non-cartoony for both skin types.
*The attribute editor is using the grayed check button image, TBGreyCheckBox, it needs to use TBCheckBox. 
*There are embedded hex color codes in the source code and ui.tb.txt files, which are good for a dark backgrounds. We can create AccentColors1-n elements in the skin/skin.tb.txt, and program them with different values appropriate for the dark and light skins, and use them in the ui.tb.txt files. so each skin type will be able to look good.
*Need better icons for the player play and pause buttons, both use an arrow icon, which is confusing.
*The NFD_ChooseDirectory() does not receive the default directory string when it set in editor typescript code, so the user has to start looking for a directory starting at the current editor directory.

data.title: Add TAB scancode for Monaco on Linux
data.body: This adds the TAB scancode for Monaco on linux. The former editor, Ace, did not need this.

data.title: Force GL2 context creation on older Mesa drivers
Jm linux 863
data.body: This PR fixes a common problem with the Linux Editor and player. Depending on the Mesa library version, a 3d scene, like ToonTown, becomes a flashing mess when viewed. Urho3D has the same issue. As a first impression, it's bad. The solution is to detect and compare mesa lib versions, and if it meets the error criteria, force the graphics to revert to GL2 mode.

data.title: Linux only ForceGL2 based in gfxlib version
data.body:
This PR fixes a common problem with the Linux Editor and player. Depending on a specific Mesa library version, a 3d scene, like ToonTown, becomes a flashing mess when viewed.  Urho3D has the same issue.  As a first impression, it's bad, real bad. The solution is to detect and compare mesa lib versions, and if the linux distro is afflicted, set a value in tool.prefs, to account for this problem.  There are complications, the detection code only runs after the graphics are initialized, and the flag you need to set to make the flashing stop can only be set before the graphics are initialized. So there is a one execution lag to starting the fix in the editor, this is reported in the log. The editor player is passed the flag thru the command line, so that is transparent to the user. 
   For the linux standalone player, the user will have to change the Settings/Engine.json file manually to set the ForceGL2 flag, there is no way to do that automatically, since the user has to know that they need the Settings directory.
   This processing is automatic, so the user does not have to do anything, whether they have the problem or not. If they upgrade their Mesa Libs to a version that does not have the problem, it will fix itself, with the one execution lag.

data.title: Expose fontFamily to the monaco editor prefs
data.body: @JoshEngebretson , I've quickly exposed `fontFamily` to the monaco prefs.  Also, the AtomicNET.d.ts automatically gets added back in by the Atom editor if it exists, so I added a negative glob so this doesn't happen anymore.

data.title: Copy AtomicTool to artifacts post build if only building that target
Refine .gitignore for Script/TpeScript to only exclude non-Work d.ts
